definition: name/fame
name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
variant of 人[ren2]/"person" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 10), occurring in 兒, 兀, 兄 etc
child/son
non-syllabic diminutive suffix/retroflex final
erhua variant of 惡名|恶名[e4 ming2]
erhua variant of 應名|应名[ying1 ming2]
erhua variant of 混名[hun4 ming2]
erhua variant of 起名[qi3 ming2]

sentences.english: Dan you tell me the name of the girl who was here yesterday?
sentences.chinese: 请告诉我昨天来这搭的阿谁女人的名儿好吗？

sentences.english: I'm sorry, I can't remember your name.
sentences.chinese: 对不起，我想不起你的名儿了。

sentences.english: The man who told me thellos refused to tell me hellos name.
sentences.chinese: 陈诉我这事的人不肯告知我他的名儿。

sentences.english: In both East and West, names are essential to success.
sentences.chinese: 在东方和西方，名儿对乐成来讲都是至关重要的。

sentences.english: I'm looking for aman whose name is John.
sentences.chinese: 我在寻觅一名男士，他的名儿叫约翰。

sentences.english: Mary is writing her name on the blackboard.
sentences.chinese: 玛丽正把她的名儿写在黑板上。

sentences.english: May I have your name and room number?
sentences.chinese: 您能告诉我您的名儿与房间号头吗？

sentences.english: The boy is named for [after] his grandfather.
sentences.chinese: 这男孩是以祖父的名字起名儿的。

sentences.english: I have nearly otten hellos name.
sentences.chinese: 我差点把他的名儿忘了。

definition: erhua variant of 起名[qi3 ming2]
pet name for a child/childhood name
pet name for a child/infant name
variant of 叫[jiao4]
to shout/to call/to order/to ask/to be called/by (indicates agent in the passive mood)
to read smoothly (of text)/to blurt out (without thinking)/to suit one's taste (of food)
(coll.) some day/one of these days
auxiliary showing sth happened in the past
I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)
I/me/we/my home/our house
to be called/to be referred to as
(dialect) girl
mythological daughter of Fiery Emperor 炎帝[Yan2 di4] who turned into bird Jingwei 精衛|精卫[Jing1 wei4] after drowning
odd/unusual/I can't believe that ...
reason
to think/this/which?/how? (literary)/Taiwan pr. [ren4]
old variant of 您[nin2]
(old) child, particularly referring to the son who resembles his father
three (colloquial equivalent of 三個|三个)
to caterwaul/to call like an animal in heat
